title: iSamples Model
text:
physicalSample
Startup schema for iSamples sample registry integration. updated from 0.2 by synchronizing the vocabulary enumerations, change ‘id’ to ‘@id’ and ‘schema’ to ‘$schema’. Schema name is iSamplesSchemaBasic0.2.1.json. Target JSON schema version is http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema# SMR 2022-10-07
URI: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1

title: SpecimenCuration
text:
Information about the current storage of sample, access to sample, and events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation. Processing related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample.
URI: isam:SpecimenCuration
case 4

title: SpecimenCuration
text:
Slots

Slots in class SpecimenCuration.








Name
Cardinality and Range
Description
Inheritance




access_constraints
0..*  xsd:string
Cultural, legal, or other policy issues that bear on access to view, borrow, or subsample a sample or visit a sampling site.



direct





curation_location
0..1  xsd:string
Information about where and how the sample is currently stored.
direct


description
0..1  xsd:string
Free text description of the subject of a triple.
direct


label
0..1  xsd:string
a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.
direct


responsibility
0..*  xsd:string
String with person name and affiliation, or organization name, and their role relative to the parent element.
direct

title: SpecimenCuration
text:
LinkML Source


Direct

name: SpecimenCuration
description: Information about the current storage of sample, access to sample, and
  events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed
  from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation.  Processing
  related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering
  are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample.
from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
rank: 1000
slots:
- access_constraints
- curation_location
- description
- label
- responsibility



Induced

name: SpecimenCuration
description: Information about the current storage of sample, access to sample, and
  events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed
  from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation.  Processing
  related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering
  are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample.
from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
rank: 1000
attributes:
  access_constraints:
    name: access_constraints
    description: 'Cultural, legal, or other policy issues that bear on access to view,
      borrow, or subsample a sample or visit a sampling site.

      '
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    multivalued: true
    alias: access_constraints
    owner: SpecimenCuration
    domain_of:
    - SpecimenCuration
    range: string
  curation_location:
    name: curation_location
    description: Information about where and how the sample is currently stored.
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    alias: curation_location
    owner: SpecimenCuration
    domain_of:
    - SpecimenCuration
    range: string
  description:
    name: description
    description: Free text description of the subject of a triple.
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    close_mappings:
    - dct:description
    alias: description
    owner: SpecimenCuration
    domain_of:
    - PhysicalSampleRecord
    - SamplingSite
    - SamplingEvent
    - SpecimenCuration
    - SampleRelation
    range: string
  label:
    name: label
    description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name
      to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or
      dataset.
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    close_mappings:
    - rdfs:label
    alias: label
    owner: SpecimenCuration
    domain_of:
    - PhysicalSampleRecord
    - SamplingSite
    - SamplingEvent
    - SpecimenCuration
    - SampleRelation
    range: string
  responsibility:
    name: responsibility
    description: String with person name and affiliation, or organization name, and
      their role relative to the parent element.
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    multivalued: true
    alias: responsibility
    owner: SpecimenCuration
    domain_of:
    - SamplingEvent
    - SpecimenCuration
    range: string

title: informal_classification
text:
Free text classification terms, not from a controlled vocabulary; generally terms applied by collector.
URI: isam:informal_classification

title: informal_classification
text:
Applicable Classes

Classes in which this slot appears.






Name
Description




PhysicalSampleRecord
This is a data object that is a digital representation of a physical sample, and thus shares the same identifier as the physical object. It provides descriptive properties for any iSamples physical sample, URI for the metadata record is same as URI for physical sample– digital object is considered twin of physical object, a representation. IGSN is recommended. Must be a URI that can be dereferenced on the web.

title: informal_classification
text:
Properties

Range: xsd:string
Multivalued: True

title: informal_classification
text:
Identifier and Mapping Information

Schema Source

from schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1

rank: 1000

multivalued: true
alias: informal_classification

- PhysicalSampleRecord
range: string

title: iSamples Model
text:
iSamples Glossary








Term
Definition
source




Peel
Acetate peels are replicas of etched surfaces embedded in sheets of cellulose acetate. These replicas are usually so detailed that the fine structure of shells and various sedimentary rocks can be easily studied under a light microscope. Because these peels can be quickly and easily produced, the procedure is now commonly used in most geologic laboratories.
Wilson and Palmer, 1988, doi: 10.1017/S2475262200005074

    name: location
    description: geopatial location of site; required default is WGS84 latitude, longitude
      in decimal degrees. Elevation as a string with number, unit of measure, and
      datum.
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    domain: SamplingSite
    alias: location
    owner: SamplingSite
    domain_of:
    - SamplingSite
    range: GeospatialCoordLocation
  place_name:
    name: place_name
    description: one or more names by which the sampling site is known.
    from_schema: http://resource.isamples.org/schema/0.2.1
    domain: SamplingSite
    multivalued: true
    alias: place_name
    owner: SamplingSite
    domain_of:
    - SamplingSite
    range: string

title: related_resource
text:
link to related resource with relationship property to indicate nature of connection. Target should be identifier for a resource.
URI: isam:related_resource

title: related_resource
text:
Applicable Classes

Classes in which this slot appears.






Name
Description




PhysicalSampleRecord
This is a data object that is a digital representation of a physical sample, and thus shares the same identifier as the physical object. It provides descriptive properties for any iSamples physical sample, URI for the metadata record is same as URI for physical sample– digital object is considered twin of physical object, a representation. IGSN is recommended. Must be a URI that can be dereferenced on the web.

title: responsibility
text:
String with person name and affiliation, or organization name, and their role relative to the parent element.
URI: isam:responsibility

title: responsibility
text:
Applicable Classes

Classes in which this slot appears.






Name
Description




SamplingEvent
Information about the event resulting in the creation of the physical sample.


SpecimenCuration
Information about the current storage of sample, access to sample, and events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation. Processing related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample.

title: has_material_category
text:
The kind of material that constitutes the sample.
URI: isam:has_material_category

title: has_material_category
text:
Applicable Classes

Classes in which this slot appears.






Name
Description




PhysicalSampleRecord
This is a data object that is a digital representation of a physical sample, and thus shares the same identifier as the physical object. It provides descriptive properties for any iSamples physical sample, URI for the metadata record is same as URI for physical sample– digital object is considered twin of physical object, a representation. IGSN is recommended. Must be a URI that can be dereferenced on the web.

title: has_material_category
text:
Properties

Range: xsd:anyURI
Multivalued: True

GeospatialCoordLocation
A physical location in decimal degrees using EPSG:4326. Elevation is is expressed in meters relative to the WGS84 ellipsoid.

title: curation_location
text:
Information about where and how the sample is currently stored.
URI: isam:curation_location

title: curation_location
text:
Applicable Classes

Classes in which this slot appears.






Name
Description




SpecimenCuration
Information about the current storage of sample, access to sample, and events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation. Processing related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample.

title: curation_location
text:
Properties

Range: xsd:string
Multivalued: None
